headline: Why UPS Stock Plunged in April
summary: UPS and other shipping companies were hit hard by the early April tariff announcement.  Shares of United Parcel Service (NYSE: UPS) plunged as much as 18% following the early April U.S. tariff announcement and were not able to regain much of that drop in the weeks that followed.  United Parcel Service also has been attempting to streamline and focus only on its most profitable lines of business, dumping lower-margin customers like Amazon in the process.

United Parcel Service also has been attempting to streamline and focus only on its most profitable lines of business, dumping lower-margin customers like Amazon in the process.

headline: HSBC cuts UPS rating as ’tariffs overshadow self-help’
summary: Investing.com -- HSBC has downgraded United Parcel Service (NYSE:UPS) to Hold from Buy and slashed its price target to $105 from $140 per share.

headline: UPS Stock Has Upside Despite Recession Fears
